title: Most significant natural disasters worldwide by death toll up to 2019
summary: The Most significant Natural in the disasters worldwide was Natural Cyclone_Nargis_storm_surge(Myanmar_May_2-5_2008) , who made 220000 toll .
The most significant Natural was Earthquake(Pakistan_October_8_2005) , with just 26200 toll .

In second place was Natural Earthquake(Haiti_January_12_2010) with 159000 toll ; third place went to Natural Earthquake_tsunami(Thailand_December_26_2004) with 220000 toll ; fourth place went to Natural Earthquake(Iran_December_26_2003) with 26200 toll and fifth place went to Natural Tropical_cyclone_storm_surge(Bangladesh_April_29-30_1991) , who was 139000 toll .
gold: The statistic shows the most significant natural disasters by death toll from 1980 to 2019 . In 2010 , the earthquake in Haiti killed 159,000 people . Ten deadliest natural disasters worldwide since 1980 According to data published by Münchener Rückversicherungs-Gesellschaft ( or Munich Re ) , the second-largest global reinsurance group as of 2017 , the tsunami struck in 2004 was the deadliest natural disaster to occur worldwide between the years 1980 and 2019 .
